Main Objectives: 1. Summarize energy audit recommendations; 2. Guide future retrofit projects; 3. Reduce energy consumption; 4. Improve occupant comfort
Key Actions: 1. Conduct energy audits of tribal buildings; 2. Develop data monitoring plan (tracking energy use/comfort); 3. Create maintenance checklists; 4. Identify training/funding opportunities; 5. Submit quarterly reports to DOE; 6. Coordinate with regional energy projects
Stakeholders: 1. Aniak Traditional Council; 2. CCHRC (Cold Climate Housing Research Center); 3. Energy Audits of Alaska; 4. Nuvista Electric Light & Power/CEMAI; 5. Department of Energy; 6. Local staff/contractors
Timeline: 2017-2018 (with quarterly reports submitted Oct-Dec 2017 and Jan-Mar 2018)

Main Objectives: Improve energy efficiency, reduce energy costs, improve building safety and comfort
Key Actions: Conduct energy audits, create maintenance plans, submit quarterly reports, perform outreach activities
Stakeholders: CCHRC, Energy Audits of Alaska, Kwigillingok Tribe, Nuvista Electric Light & Power / CEMAI, Department of Energy
Timeline: Quarterly reports for Oct-Dec 2017 and Jan-Mar 2018; outreach in 2017 and 2018

Main Objectives: Summarize energy audit recommendations and guide future retrofit projects
Key Actions: - Create Energy Action Plan; - Communicate with Tribe representatives; - Interview experts; - Conduct energy audits; - Track baseline data; - Submit quarterly reports; - Coordinate with regional energy projects
Stakeholders: - Atmautluak Traditional Council; - Project staff; - Energy Audits of Alaska; - Nuvista Electric Light & Power / CEMAI (Bertha Prince); - CCHRC; - Community members; - Alaskans

Main Objectives: Reduce energy costs, improve building safety and comfort, facilitate future energy reduction projects
Key Actions: - Conduct energy audits ;  - Implement monthly maintenance checklists ;  - Seek financing for retrofits ;  - Schedule training for personnel ;  - Outreach activities (presentations, flyers, video) ;  - Submit quarterly reports (Oct-Dec 2017, Jan-Mar 2018)
Stakeholders: - Cold Climate Housing Research Center (CCHRC) ;  - Energy Audits of Alaska ;  - Tribe/Akiachak Council ;  - Nuvista Electric Light & Power (Bertha Prince) ;  - US Department of Energy Office of Indian Energy ;  - Maintenance personnel ;  - Building occupants
